result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel J Delong was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Daniel J Delong was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Delong in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Cases heard: 15CM143, 15CT61, 15CF483, 15FO151

10:36 am. Court calls case.
Parties agree to have this matter heard 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney Sheets concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT61 - 2nd
Ct 1: NO CONTEST

15CM143 - 3rd 
Ct 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

15CF483 - 4th
Counsel waives reading of information.
Ct 1: NO CONTEST
Ct 3: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.

15CT61 
Ct 1: Guilty
Ct 2: Dismissed outright
Ct 3: DRI

15CM143
Ct 1: Guilty
Ct 2: Dismissed outright
Ct 3 & 4: DRI

15CF483
Ct 1: Guilty
Ct 3: Guilty
Ct 2: Dismissed outright
Cts 4 & 5: DRI

15FO151
DRI
  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:

DOT assessment 
12 months IID & REV

$26.45 blood draw
29 months IID & REV
Jail sentence concurrent with 15CT61

18 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision
Conditions same as previous

Decision on May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Delong in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:49 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  Matter is whether this is a felony 4th offense or a 3rd offense.  
Atty Sheets stipulates to the facts brought out at the preliminary hearing held 2/8/2016 in front of the Court Commissioner. 

Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Cousins makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes additional 

Court will not make a ruling today, wants the parties to brief the matter and wants legislative history as to the convictions statute the DA referred to.  
State's brief to be filed by March 18, 2016. 
Defense's response brief to be filed by April 18, 2016. 
State's reply brief by May 2, 2016.  

(Court sets 15CM143 for jury trial on 4/14/16.)  Decision scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Delong in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Daniel J Delong in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:16 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff. 

Atty Cousins asks the court to take Judicial notice of 15CT61, 15CM143, 15TR305.

Officer J. Klein is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Exhibit #1 is referred to during testimony. 
Atty Cousins moves for the admission of Exhibit #1.  No objection by Atty Sheets. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 
Cross exam by Atty Sheets. 

Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the parties. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will set this matter for an adjourned preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm
